Everit - Maven OSGi plugin
Last Published: 2015-09-29  | Version: 3.3.0
Overview
  • Usage
  • Goals
Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

eosgi:integration-test

Full name:

org.everit.osgi.dev:eosgi-maven-plugin:3.3.0:integration-test

Description:

Runs the integration-tests on OSGi environment. It is necessary to add org.everit.osgi.dev.testrunner and one of the engines as a dependency to the project to make this goal work.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • Requires dependency resolution of artifacts in scope: test.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: integration-test.
  • Invokes the execution of the lifecycle phase package prior to executing itself.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
consoleLog boolean - Whether to log the output of the started test JVMs to the standard output and standard error or not.
Default value is: true.
User property is: eosgi.consoleLog.
copyMode String - If link than the generated files in the dist folder will be links instead of real copied files. Two possible values: symbolicLink, file. In case this is an incrementel update, the default mode is the same as the mode of the previous build. In case this is a clean build, the default mode is 'file'.
User property is: eosgi.copyMode.
distFolder String - Path to folder where the distribution will be generated. The content of this folder will be overridden if the files with same name already exist.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}/eosgi-dist.
User property is: eosgi.distFolder.
environmentId String - Comma separated list of the id of the environments that should be processed. Default is * that means all environments.
Default value is: *.
User property is: eosgi.environmentId.
environments EnvironmentConfiguration[] - The environments on which the tests should run.
executedProject MavenProject - (no description)
User property is: executedProject.
jacoco JacocoSettings - The jacoco code coverage generation settings. To see the possible settings see JacocoSettings.
localRepository ArtifactRepository - (no description)
Default value is: ${localRepository}.
project MavenProject - The Maven project.
User property is: project.
remoteRepositories List - (no description)
Default value is: ${project.remoteArtifactRepositories}.
reportFolder String - The folder where the integration test reports will be placed. Please note that the content of this folder will be deleted before running the tests.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}/eosgi-report.
User property is: eosgi.testReportFolder.
servicePort String - Comma separated list of ports of currently running OSGi containers. Such ports are normally opened with richConsole. In case this property is defined, dependency changes will be pushed via the defined ports.
User property is: eosgi.servicePort.
skipTests boolean - Skipping this plugin.
Default value is: false.
User property is: maven.test.skip.
sourceDistPath String - The directory where there may be additional files to create the distribution package (optional).
Default value is: ${basedir}/src/dist/.
User property is: eosgi.sourceDistPath.

Parameter Details

consoleLog:

Whether to log the output of the started test JVMs to the standard output and standard error or not.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.consoleLog
  • Default: true

copyMode:

If link than the generated files in the dist folder will be links instead of real copied files. Two possible values: symbolicLink, file. In case this is an incrementel update, the default mode is the same as the mode of the previous build. In case this is a clean build, the default mode is 'file'.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.copyMode

distFolder:

Path to folder where the distribution will be generated. The content of this folder will be overridden if the files with same name already exist.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.distFolder
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}/eosgi-dist

environmentId:

Comma separated list of the id of the environments that should be processed. Default is * that means all environments.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.environmentId
  • Default: *

environments:

The environments on which the tests should run.
  • Type: org.everit.osgi.dev.maven.EnvironmentConfiguration[]
  • Required: No

executedProject:

(no description)
  • Type: org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject
  • Required: No
  • User Property: executedProject

jacoco:

The jacoco code coverage generation settings. To see the possible settings see JacocoSettings.
  • Type: org.everit.osgi.dev.maven.JacocoSettings
  • Required: No

localRepository:

(no description)
  • Type: org.apache.maven.artifact.repository.ArtifactRepository
  • Required: No
  • Default: ${localRepository}

project:

The Maven project.
  • Type: org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject
  • Required: No
  • User Property: project

remoteRepositories:

(no description)
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No
  • Default: ${project.remoteArtifactRepositories}

reportFolder:

The folder where the integration test reports will be placed. Please note that the content of this folder will be deleted before running the tests.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.testReportFolder
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}/eosgi-report

servicePort:

Comma separated list of ports of currently running OSGi containers. Such ports are normally opened with richConsole. In case this property is defined, dependency changes will be pushed via the defined ports.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.servicePort

skipTests:

Skipping this plugin.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • User Property: maven.test.skip
  • Default: false

sourceDistPath:

The directory where there may be additional files to create the distribution package (optional).
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: eosgi.sourceDistPath
  • Default: ${basedir}/src/dist/
